column3: BTW, for next time: for some straightforward change like this it's better to combine the commits into one pull request\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/5fd8db3ac28e244d042aa46dfef2a8513b4b657b for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
I'm just not working on my computer, and I did it the easy way. sorry.\n
ACK.  Need a better commit message than "upgraded to serial X"  Describe the changes we are importing.\n
I added information about the change. \n- Add aarch64 to the list of lib64 architectures\n
What a cool commit-msg battle ^^, great you are supplying autotools updates :).\n
BTW, if aarch64 is a goal, last I checked protobuf lacks aarch64 support.   Fedora has patches for it.\n
And yes, these commit messages need to be more descriptive of what it actually does, and it is annoying to have it split into multiple commits and separate PR's.\n
I don't think aarch64 is the goal per se, but it doesn't hurt keeping the m4's up to date with upstream.\n
